Faisem's approach to enhancing employability involves collaboration with various health, social services, employment agencies, and social organizations, aiming to create a supportive network that includes social enterprises, specific employment and training programs. In 2022, Faisem's services in Andalusia helped 3,677 people, with 832 securing jobs. The foundation also supports public employment initiatives for people with mental health issues, achieving over 500 hires in the public sector over three years. In Huelva, the foundation facilitated 177 job placements for 109 individuals last year, through diverse employment and training initiatives.

title: Madrid refuerza la Fundación de Investigación Biomédica del Hospital Infanta Sofía y del Henares con la incorporación ...
summary: The Community of Madrid has boosted the Biomedical Research and Innovation Foundation of the University Hospitals Infanta Sofía and Henares by including Tajo Hospital, to promote scientific work across these public centers. This effort, in partnership with the European University of Madrid and Francisco de Vitoria University, seeks to advance research, training, and scientific programs in Biomedicine and Health Sciences. Since starting in 2018, the foundation's workforce has grown from 220 to 400 professionals in 2023, with 53 engaged in competitive projects. From 2019 to 2023, it published 938 scientific works, with 217 led by the hospitals' staff and 104 in the top 10% of publications, reflecting their high quality. This collaboration aims to bolster scientific knowledge and research opportunities at these hospitals, enhancing their future clinical applications.

title: El Hospital Universitario Ramón y Cajal celebra el 20º aniversario de su Fundación para la Investigación Biomédica
summary: The Ramón y Cajal University Hospital in the Community of Madrid celebrated the 20th anniversary of its Foundation for Biomedical Research (FIBioHRC) with an event highlighted by the presence of Dr. Michael Rosbash, Nobel Prize in Physiology and Medicine 2017, who gave a masterclass. The day, co-organized with the AstraZeneca Foundation and the Nobel Prize Outreach Association, focused on reviewing the past, present, and future of the foundation, promoting scientific vocations among young people. The FIBioHRC, a non-profit entity, is dedicated to fostering scientific-technical research and research training in health sciences to improve the hospital's care quality. Since its creation, it has managed more than 5,000 research and innovation projects, hiring 1,619 researchers and generating significant advances in the biomedical field.

title: La Xunta integra en el Sergas tres fundaciones públicas de las que dependen 2.900 investigadores sanitarios
summary: On January 1st, the Xunta will incorporate three public health research foundations into the Galician Health Service (Sergas), affecting 2,900 researchers across 181 groups. This move, aimed at enhancing research, teaching, scientific development, and innovation in healthcare, will see these entities now operating under the Health Department through Sergas, with changes to their statutes and official names. The foundations will focus on different health areas across Galicia, applying public sector instrumental entities' regulations and joining the Audit and Control Commission. Workers will benefit from improved conditions, being recognized as public health employees, with collective agreements, standardized remuneration, and the completion of a job offer for 34 positions to stabilize researchers. This integration, budgeted at €43.2 million for 2024, follows the approval of the Lei 7/2022, aiming to enhance scientific development and healthcare. Additionally, the Xunta has allocated €127 million for CAR-T cancer drugs, emphasizing personalized and precision medicine for blood cancer patients, with the construction of a center for advanced therapies underway, marking Santiago as the first Spanish city to produce these medications publicly.

title: El talento y la creatividad de 'Ciencia Brilante' del IIS Galicia Sur lucen en el Centro Comercial Gran Vía
summary: The 'Brilliant Science' event organized by IIS Galicia Sur at the Gran Vía Shopping Center in Vigo highlighted the creativity of young participants through the 'Scientific Christmas Lights Designs' contest. Eva Poveda, the scientific director, and Beatriz Gil de Araujo de Simón, director of the Fundación Biomédica Galicia Sur, awarded prizes to the winners, emphasizing the initiative as part of the institute's Annual Plan for Scientific Culture. The winners, Alexandra Alonso Simón, Gaukhar Kalkiyeva, and Antía Fernández Piñeiro, presented designs that combined science and art, focusing on themes like vaccines, the tree of life with DNA, and cardiovascular diseases. Their designs, which aimed to bring basic scientific knowledge to the youth of Vigo through workshops and this contest, will be displayed at the shopping center until January 7. This initiative is part of a broader effort to promote scientific culture among the community.

title: Investigadoras del IIS Galicia Sur llevan a centros educativos de Pontevedra el papel de la mujer en la ciencia
summary: Researchers from the South Galicia Health Research Institute (IIS Galicia Sur) are carrying out various activities in eleven educational centers in the province of Pontevedra to raise awareness about the contributions of women to science. The goal is to create female role models for students by sharing the professional experiences of women in science through talks, games, and small scientific experiments. This initiative is part of the celebration of the International Day of Women and Girls in Science on February 11 and supports IIS Galicia Sur's strategic commitment to gender equality, as detailed in its Strategic Plan 2022-2026 and the Equality Plan of the Biomedical Foundation Galicia Sur. The institute, where women make up 60% of the 845 researchers, also implements protocols to prevent sexual harassment at work.

title: Muere de cáncer a los 40 años Guillermo Pousada, premio nacional al mejor investigador en VIH
summary: Guillermo Pousada Fernández, a biologist and the youngest recipient of the National Award for the best HIV researcher in 2021, died at 40 after a battle with cancer. Pousada, who had a degree in Biology and a PhD in Human Genetics and Molecular Biology from the University of Vigo, was honored for his research, particularly in rare diseases. Since late 2017, he had been leading clinical trials for the infectious diseases group at Hospital Álvaro Cunqueiro in Vigo. Diagnosed with mouth cancer in 2022, Pousada shared his personal battle with the disease on social media. His funeral took place at the ex-collegiate church of Santiago de Cangas, after his body was moved from the funeral home.

title: La Xunta hará empleados de la sanidad pública a 588 trabajadores de investigación
summary: The Xunta de Galicia will transform 588 research workers from health institutes into public health employees at the beginning of 2024. This change is due to the adaptation of the three Galician health research foundations to the regional public sector, after approving modifications in their statutes. The measure will affect 140 researchers and 374 technicians and administrative workers. The aim is to stabilize the staff through a decree, currently under review, which will include almost all research profiles, establishing their career path and adjusting salaries to those of civil servants, with the inclusion of triennials and quinquennials. Galicia positions itself as a pioneer in Spain with this regulation that maintains labor contracts without differences or losses, and allows researchers to become permanent staff after a merit competition and subsequent evaluation. The foundations will receive funding in the Galicia budgets for 2024, with specific allocations for each one.

title: Aprobados los nuevos estatutos de las fundaciones gallegas de investigación sanitaria
summary: The regional government has approved new statutes for Galician health research foundations, incorporating them into the autonomous public sector for the first time in the 2024 budget. The Santiago de Compostela Health Research Institute Foundation will receive €22.7 million, the Professor Novoa Santos Foundation €10.5 million, and the Galicia Sur Biomedical Foundation €10 million. Pending further approval by the Consello de la Xunta, this completes their integration process. The foundations will be renamed as follows: the Galician Public Biomedical Research Foundation Inibic, the Galician Public Health Research Institute Foundation of Santiago de Compostela, and the Galician Public Biomedical Research Foundation Galicia Sur, each covering specific health areas in Galicia.

title: La investigación sanitaria gallega saca músculo en A Coruña
summary: Galicia's health research showcased its strength in A Coruña at the "Biointegra Saúde" event, marking its return after the COVID pandemic pause. Over 200 scientists presented the outcomes of around a hundred projects. The event aimed to highlight the R&D carried out by the three health research institutes in the Galician community. Women lead the scientific direction of these institutes, emphasizing the unstoppable advancement of women in science. The event also aimed to foster synergies among research groups to enhance project development within the community. The Inibic institute in A Coruña highlighted its positive research outcomes over the past year, noting an increase in nationally developed research and a significant boost in international project applications. The institute faces the challenge of reaccreditation in 2024, with preparations already underway.

title: La fundación de la casa Escariz firma un acuerdo con la Novoa Santos para impulsar la investigación
summary: The Escariz House Foundation and the Professor Novoa Santos Foundation have signed a collaboration agreement to promote scientific research in medical, pharmaceutical, and care treatment for disabled and sick people. This framework agreement will allow the development of joint programs that encourage cooperation between both entities, aligning with the objectives and functions of each for mutual benefit and the rational use of resources. The Manuel Piñeiro Pose Foundation, manager of the Escariz House, aims to promote research that contributes to the assistance of sick or disabled groups, thus reinforcing its commitment to the community through this new agreement.

title: Científicos del Inibic de A Coruña avanzan en el desarrollo de un tratamiento inyectable para la artrosis de rodilla
summary: Scientists at the Biomedical Research Institute of A Coruña (Inibic) and the Professor Novoa Santos Foundation are making progress in developing an innovative treatment for knee osteoarthritis. This treatment involves an injectable drug, fenofibrate, encapsulated in microspheres for prolonged release via intra-articular injection. The project has recently received funding of 607,000 euros from the Galician Innovation Agency (GAIN) through the Ignicia program, aiming to create a spin-off company to commercialize the technology by 2025. The treatment is designed to be more effective and reduce side effects compared to oral administration, targeting the damaged tissue directly. The project, which has already completed preclinical trials in animals, is set to move into clinical trials with the new funding. This development represents a significant step forward in treating osteoarthritis, a condition currently without a cure, focusing on reducing inflammation and pain and potentially slowing the disease's progression.

title: El Servicio de Reumatología del Chuac y la Fundación Profesor Nóvoa Santos,premiados por un proyecto de realidad virtual
summary: The Rheumatology Service of the University Hospital Complex of A Coruña (Chuac) and the Professor Nóvoa Santos Foundation have been awarded in the III edition of the Ennova Health 2023 Awards, in the category of Telehealth and e-learning. The recognition was for their project "Clinical management of a person with monoarthritis: an immersive virtual reality environment". This project, which had the collaboration of several hospitals and the University of Salamanca, offers an interactive virtual reality simulator to practice clinical management and decision-making in a patient with monoarthritis. The use of simulation technology as an effective and safe method to learn and improve skills necessary in medical procedures, thus improving the quality of patient care, is highlighted.

title: Acuerdo entre las fundaciones Piñeiro Pose y Novoa Santos
summary: The Manuel Piñeiro Pose Foundation and the Professor Novoa Santos Foundation have entered into a collaboration agreement to promote research in the healthcare sector. This partnership was officially signed by Jose María Fuciños Sendín, president of the Manuel Piñeiro Pose Foundation, and Luis Verde, healthcare area manager of A Coruña and president of the Professor Novoa Santos Foundation. The agreement aims to support initiatives that advance healthcare research, benefiting invalid and sick individuals. The Manuel Piñeiro Pose Foundation, which manages and owns two buildings known as casa Escariz, emphasizes its commitment to fulfilling the wishes of its benefactor, Manuel Piñeiro Pose, by making donations to various charitable entities in the city. This collaboration marks a significant step towards enhancing healthcare research and support in A Coruña.

title: A Coruña impulsa un programa de rehabilitación para pacientes con cáncer
summary: A Coruña has launched a rehabilitation program for cancer patients, a collaborative effort between the area's health sector, the Professor Novoa Santos Foundation, and the Spanish Association Against Cancer (AECC). This initiative aims to improve the therapeutic process and convalescence of those affected by cancer. The agreement, which is renewable annually, will support clinical research projects, teaching, and the enhancement of clinical services' quality for cancer care. The program emphasizes the importance of rehabilitation in cancer care, considering the increasing cancer prevalence, survival rates, and the aging population. It seeks to address not only clinical aspects but also the functional deficits that may arise throughout the treatment and recovery process, highlighting the need for interdisciplinary work between oncology and rehabilitation services.

title: A Coruña impulsa un programa de rehabilitación para enfermos oncológicos
summary: A Coruña has started a cancer patient rehabilitation program through a partnership between the local health area of A Coruña and Cee, the Professor Novoa Santos Foundation, and the Provincial Board of the Spanish Association Against Cancer (AECC) at the University Hospital (Chuac). The program seeks to improve the quality of clinical care, research, and education for cancer patients, acknowledging the increasing significance of rehabilitation in holistic patient care due to the growing number of cancer cases, higher survival rates, and the rising average age of the population. This annually renewable agreement underscores the public health system's dedication to enhancing the quality of care for cancer patients.

title: El ejercicio, aliado frente al cáncer en A Coruña
summary: In A Coruña, a pioneering exercise program for breast cancer patients has shown positive outcomes in its first year. Developed by the medical oncology and rehabilitation services at Chuac Hospital, the program, supported by the Professor Novoa Santos Foundation and the Provincial Board of the Spanish Association Against Cancer (AECC), aims to encourage physical activity among this group. Initially targeting a small group undergoing neoadjuvant chemotherapy, the goal is to expand to more cancer types. Nearly 50 women have participated, experiencing improved treatment tolerance and reduced relapse rates. The program, emphasizing the importance of exercise during and after cancer treatment, aligns with growing evidence that physical activity can significantly lower cancer risk and mortality. This initiative is part of a broader effort to integrate exercise into cancer care, reflecting a shift towards holistic patient rehabilitation.

title: Gilead promueve, por segundo año consecutivo, el desarrollo de herramientas que permitan cuantificar el estado de ...
summary: Gilead Sciences has launched the second edition of the Gilead-PRO grants for the second consecutive year, aimed at developing strategies to enhance the dissemination and implementation of Patient-Reported Outcomes (PROs) in clinical practice. This initiative demonstrates Gilead's commitment to listening to people living with HIV and improving their care process by fostering the use of tools that incorporate the patient's perspective in disease management and improve long-term quality of life. Following the success of the first edition, this initiative seeks to support specific projects that quantify the health status of people living with HIV using PRO tools in clinical practice. The second edition has recognized seven projects across Madrid, Andalusia, Galicia, Asturias, and the Balearic Islands, with a total funding of 200,000 euros, allowing a maximum of 30,000 euros per project to be executed within 24 months. These projects aim to benefit individuals with HIV, the scientific community, and society at large by improving the quality of healthcare through better doctor-patient communication and decision-making. The selection was made by an independent committee of HIV specialists, based on scientific quality, methodology, and alignment with the needs of people living with HIV and Spain's strategic goals for HIV and STI prevention and control from 2021 to 2030.

title: Las Rozas se suma a la prevención de enfermedades cardiovasculares
summary: Las Rozas, a municipality, has joined efforts in the prevention and awareness of cardiovascular diseases through a collaboration with the Grupo OAT Observatorio de la Salud. This partnership will launch a comprehensive campaign aimed at educating the community about cardiovascular health, emphasizing preventive measures, treatment adherence, and the adoption of healthy habits. The initiative, led by Mayor José de la Uz and Grupo OAT's president José Luis Casteig, will span two years, focusing on both primary prevention in the general population and secondary prevention among chronic patients. This project reflects a shared commitment to enhancing the health and well-being of Las Rozas' residents, addressing the significant challenge posed by cardiovascular diseases, which remain the leading cause of death in Spain. Through this collaborative effort, Las Rozas aims to improve disease management and promote a healthier lifestyle among its citizens, contributing to the sustainability of the healthcare system.

title: Las Rozas participará en un proyecto para la prevención y concienciación de enfermedades cardiovasculares - Enpapel
summary: Las Rozas will join a two-year project focused on the prevention and awareness of cardiovascular diseases, in collaboration with the OAT Health Observatory Group. This program aims to adopt preventive measures, ensure patients' compliance with treatments (adherence), and promote healthy habits. The cardiovascular risk profile of the population will be investigated, and efforts will be made to improve adherence in chronic patients, with the goal of driving a positive change in the management of these diseases. The project reflects the commitment of both entities to improve the health and quality of life of the community, in a context where cardiovascular diseases are the leading cause of death in Spain, affecting 30% of the adult population with risk factors such as hypertension, smoking, and diabetes, among others.

title: Un proyecto terapéutico del Macarena, premio extraordinario del Observatorio de la Salud OAT
summary: A therapeutic project from Macarena Hospital was awarded an extraordinary prize by the Health Observatory OAT for its innovative approach to improving adherence to home-based polysomnography in children with sleep disorders. The project, named Apneorl, was led by nurses Beatriz Tena, María Eugenia Acosta, and Trinidad Modesto from the Otorhinolaryngology Service. It aimed to screen patients with sleep apnea-hypopnea syndrome (SAHS) for suitability for adenotonsillectomy and septoplasty, evaluating the efficiency of a home-based polysomnography program (PRD) in improving the condition. The initiative involved using a storybook, "El sueño del Astronauta Prim", to reduce fear and rejection among children undergoing the test, with digital versions accessible via QR codes. The project also focused on patient and professional satisfaction with the diagnosis and surgical procedures, supported by detailed instructions for using the equipment. The OAT Health Adherence 2023 awards recognized the project's contribution to therapeutic adherence and the healthcare field.

title: Eurocaja Rural y el Colegio de Médicos de Segovia se unen para fomentar la formación e investigación entre los colegiados de la provincia
summary: Eurocaja Rural and the Scientific Foundation of the College of Physicians of Segovia have entered into a collaboration agreement to promote training and research among the province's medical professionals. This partnership aims to enhance the educational, cultural, and scientific research activities related to health issues promoted by the medical institution. The agreement, signed by Víctor Manuel Martín López, General Director of Eurocaja Rural, and Graciliano Estrada Trigueros, President of the Foundation, signifies Eurocaja Rural's commitment to supporting business and social development in Segovia. It focuses on continuous training and research activities primarily for physicians registered with the Official College of Segovia. The collaboration includes providing scholarships and aids, promoting research in health, organizing continuous medical training courses, and funding publications on health topics. This agreement is valid until December 31, 2024, and is part of Eurocaja Rural's effort to generate wealth, employment, and provide personalized financial services in Segovia.

title: «En los primeros meses de la covid separamos el grano de la paja»
summary: José Hernández, former director of the Scientific Foundation of the College of Physicians in Segovia, was honored by the Official College of Physicians of Segovia for his work during the early months of the COVID-19 pandemic. His tenure at the foundation, which lasted about four years, was marked by significant contributions to the medical field during a critical time. Delia de Lucas has assumed his role following his departure. The event highlighted Hernández's efforts in navigating the challenges posed by the pandemic, emphasizing the importance of distinguishing valuable information and actions ("separating the wheat from the chaff") amidst the crisis.

title: Delia de Lucas, nueva directora de la Fundación Científica del Colegio de Médicos de Segovia
summary: Delia de Lucas has been appointed as the new director of the Scientific Foundation of the College of Physicians in Segovia, taking over from Dr. José Mariano Hernández. As a board member of the Official College of Physicians, focusing on Physicians in Training, she was tasked by the president, Graciliano Estrada, to lead the foundation. De Lucas, who also works as a family doctor in Cantalejo, aims to continue the foundation's core activities such as continuous training, scholarships for residents, and scientific recognition awards. She acknowledges the high standards set by previous activities and sees her role as challenging yet stimulating. The foundation plans to maintain its commitment to continuous education, with an upcoming event on March 15 for the presentation of the II Clinical Cases Contest for Resident Physicians. De Lucas values the role of family doctors in rural settings and is determined to support primary care in such communities, drawing from her personal experience and professional training in rural healthcare.

title: "Es frustrante no poder dar la atención médica que la población merece"
summary: Delia de Lucas San Atanasio, a family doctor from Cantalejo and newly appointed director of the Scientific Foundation of the Segovia Medical Association, expresses frustration at not being able to provide the level of medical care she believes the population deserves. Despite the challenges, including a lack of doctors and the potential for worsening conditions due to retirements, Delia is committed to maintaining the foundation's successful initiatives, such as continuous training courses, scholarships for medical residents, and scientific research awards. She highlights the importance of continuous education and support for research, acknowledging the difficult situation in the medical profession, with strikes in Madrid and Catalonia indicating broader systemic issues. Delia chose to specialize in family medicine and work in a rural setting despite the challenges, emphasizing the need for long-term planning to address the shortage of doctors and ensure quality patient care.

title: Homenaje al director saliente de la Fundación Científica, José Hernández
summary: The Scientific Foundation of the College of Physicians has paid tribute to Dr. José Mariano Hernández, who led the entity for the last four years, and has welcomed his successor, the young Dr. Delia de Lucas. During his management, Hernández focused on strengthening Continuing Education and stimulating research among physicians, fundamental aspects for the medical community. Despite the challenges posed by the Covid-19 pandemic, which forced the intensification of online broadcasts, the Foundation managed to reach 4,000 people through its events in 2022. Hernández expressed his satisfaction with the support received and the success of the initiatives, although he regretted not having achieved the Foundation's self-financing. The tribute event was attended by the distinguished hematologist María Victoria Mateos, who gave a talk on updates on multiple myeloma, closing the day with a flourish.

title: EIT Health helps accelerate AI bipolar diagnostic test launch
summary: EIT Health has significantly contributed to the early launch of a groundbreaking bipolar diagnostic test developed by the EDIT-B Consortium, which utilizes artificial intelligence (AI) to distinguish bipolar disorder from depression. Originally set for release in 2025, the test's launch has been advanced to 2023, facilitated by EIT Health's support and the network's ability to navigate recent regulatory changes. This blood diagnostic test employs RNA editing biomarkers and AI for accurate diagnosis, boasting over 80% sensitivity and specificity rates. It has passed clinical validation in two independent studies and is CE IVD-marked. The test aims to reduce the average 8-10 year diagnostic delay for bipolar disorder by offering a quicker diagnosis tool for healthcare professionals across Europe, thus improving patient care and management. The EDIT-B Consortium, supported by a €5.2 million budget and experts from various reputable organizations, highlights EIT Health's crucial role in accelerating healthcare innovation and emphasizes mental health's importance in community wellbeing.

title: Una guía para enfermeras contribuye a aumentar la tasa de vacunación en adultos
summary: A guide for nurses has been published with the goal of increasing the vaccination rate in adults, edited by the General Nursing Council with collaboration from GSK and endorsement from the National Association of Nursing and Vaccines. This free guide, distributed among the 335,000 nurses, offers essential information on vaccination, including general principles, the complete vaccination act, types of vaccines, a lifetime schedule, and tools to promote vaccination. Although pediatric vaccination exceeds 95% coverage, adult vaccination is significantly lower, with rates below 20% in some autonomous communities for the flu in the 23-24 season. The guide seeks to reinforce the importance of an updated vaccination schedule in adults for greater population health and prevention of serious diseases.

title: El Colegio de Médicos de Salamanca niega la falta de facultativos y exige «otras soluciones organizativas»
summary: The Salamanca Medical Association, chaired by Santiago Santa Cruz, has sent a letter to the Health Councilor of the Junta de Castilla y León, Alejandro Vázquez, denying the existence of a lack of doctors in Spain and rejecting the authorization to hire doctors without the specialty required by regulations. Santa Cruz argues that Spain has enough doctors relative to its population and criticizes the current health system for being outdated and inefficient. He proposes alternative organizational solutions, such as adjusting primary care in rural areas so that patients go to health centers. In addition, he criticizes the hiring of doctors without a specialty and the lack of compliance with the law in private hospitals and clinics. He also mentions the problem of the recognition of specialties of non-EU doctors, noting that many doctors delay the process. The College hopes that the Health Area Management of Salamanca will facilitate the list of doctors without a specialty working in the province to contrast it with their records.

title: Los médicos alertan sobre la "grave" situación sanitaria en Salamanca: "Un hospital tan moderno no puede estar al 50%"
summary: Medical professionals in Salamanca are raising alarms about the critical health situation, emphasizing that a modern hospital operating at only 50% capacity is unacceptable. They highlighted issues such as long waiting lists for consultations and surgeries, inadequate professional training, emergency services, and concerns with the Hospital Santísima Trinidad. Santiago Santa Cruz, president of the Salamanca Medical Association, criticized the outdated healthcare management model and proposed increasing government funding to reduce waiting times. He also mentioned the problem of hiring underqualified doctors due to staff shortages and suggested improving working conditions and training for medical graduates. Additionally, there's a call for serious consideration of emergency ambulance services, given the region's dispersed population, and concerns about the lack of ambulance services for a nearby private hospital, posing risks to patient safety.

title: Colegio de Médicos de Salamanca
summary: The Salamanca Medical Association is calling for greater recognition of the medical profession, highlighting the long educational journey of up to 12 years required for doctors. In 2024, as the association celebrates its 130th anniversary and nears 2,900 members, its president, Dr. Santiago Santa Cruz, has set three main goals: achieving A1 plus level status for the medical community, improving the management and funding of primary care, and raising the profile of the Salamanca Hospital Complex among the best in Spain. The demand for better management and funding emphasizes the unique and extensive training of doctors compared to other health professions, pointing out the need for proper recognition and support. Furthermore, the Association stands by professionals facing physical or verbal attacks, advocating for complete legal compensation.

title: Los médicos de Salamanca, contrarios a la prescripción de medicamentos por las enfermeras como pretende el Sacyl
summary: Doctors in Salamanca expressed their opposition to the protocols approved by Sacyl, which would allow nurses to prescribe medications in specific cases such as wounds, burns, and ostomies. The Official College of Physicians of Salamanca argues that nursing does not legally have the competence to prescribe prescription medications, citing law 29/2006 and Royal Decree 954/2015, which reserve this faculty exclusively for physicians, dentists, and podiatrists. They warn that any provision that contravenes this legal framework is null. They emphasize the importance of multidisciplinary collaboration in patient care but insist that each professional must act within their specific competencies, highlighting the responsibility and clinical leadership of the physician, based on extensive training and specialized knowledge to ensure clinical safety.

title: El Colegio de Médicos recibe a los nuevos MIR que eligen formarse en Salamanca
summary: The Salamanca College of Physicians has welcomed about 90 new resident physicians who have chosen this city to start their specialty. During an event chaired by Santiago Santa Cruz Ruiz, president of the College, they were presented with various financial, social aids, and training services, professional development, and cultural activities that the College offers. Additionally, the role of the Foundation for the Social Protection of the Medical Association, which provides economic and social support to more than 2,500 doctors and their families in Spain, having distributed about 170,000 euros in Salamanca last year, was highlighted. The meeting also served as an opportunity for the new MIRs to get to know each other and discuss their future professional steps in an informal atmosphere.

title: Kuma Barrios y Verónica Sánchez se llevan la victoria en la Carrera Popular 'Corre con tú médico'
summary: Kuma Barrios and Verónica Sánchez won the popular race "Run with your doctor" in Salamanca, celebrated on December 10, 2023, with a record participation. The event, supported by the Official College of Physicians of Salamanca, the Provincial Council, the City Council, and the Local Police, among others, aimed to promote sports and health. The 10km urban course passed through emblematic areas of the city. The race included categories for doctors and non-doctors. In the non-doctors category, Kuma Barrios finished first with a time of 31:23, and Verónica Sánchez led the women's division with 36:41. Among doctors, José Vicente and Soraya Merchán were the fastest. The proceeds were donated to Manos Unidas.

title: Salamanca: premios RAMSA
summary: The Royal Academy of Medicine of Salamanca has awarded prizes to ten young researchers in its 2023 call, totaling 11,500 euros in prizes. These awards recognize doctors and professionals in the biosanitary field for their scientific work published in 2022/2023. The collaboration of entities such as the Medical Associations of Ávila, Salamanca, Segovia, Zamora, the IBSAL, the USAL, the AECC, and the Lilly Foundation has been fundamental. The prizes cover various categories, from the best scientific work in medicine and its specialties to innovation projects in health services and support for stays in research centers. Among the winners are researchers who have made significant contributions to medical science with studies on cancer, hematology, and other fields, demonstrating the academy's commitment to promoting scientific research and innovation in the field of health.

title: Insuficiencia cardiaca: la clave es identificar sus síntomas y anticiparse a sus efectos
summary: Heart failure is a growing cardiovascular disease, particularly affecting those over 65, leading to frequent hospital admissions due to patient decompensations. Julio Núñez, a prominent figure in cardiology, emphasizes the importance of early identification and treatment of these decompensations to prevent hospitalizations and the subsequent strain on healthcare systems. Symptoms such as fatigue, weight gain, abdominal swelling, difficulty breathing, swollen legs, and decreased urination are critical for patients to recognize. The future of treating heart failure may lie in outpatient management of decompensations to avoid hospital admissions. The disease's mortality rates are comparable to some common cancers, highlighting the severe impact on patients' quality and functional capacity. Lifestyle changes and risk factor management are essential for prevention, though the aging population presents ongoing challenges.

title: Una aplicación de IA monitoriza la insuficiencia cardiaca mediante el habla
summary: A heart failure monitoring AI application, HearO™, developed by Cordio Medical and introduced by AstraZeneca in Spain, is being evaluated by the Cardiology Service of the General Hospital of Valencia and the Valencian Society of Cardiology for monitoring heart failure through speech analysis. This mobile tool aims to detect early signs of worsening and potential complications in patients with this condition. The application can alert about decompensations up to 18 days before they occur, facilitating early intervention. So far, 30 patients have participated in the trial, showing a potential to predict 79.6% of the decompensations in stable patients with congestive heart failure. This project highlights the impact of technological innovation on improving early diagnosis and the quality of life of patients with heart failure.

title: Carolina Ruano: «No todos los niños asturianos tienen el privilegio de tener un pediatra de cabecera»
summary: Carolina Ruano, recently appointed president of the Asturian Association of Primary Care Pediatrics (AAPap), highlights the challenges facing pediatric care in Asturias. She points out the scarcity of human resources in the specialty, with a significant number of pediatric positions unfilled, especially in rural and semi-urban areas, leading to excessive workloads for existing pediatricians. This situation is exacerbated by an aging workforce and a lack of new pediatricians choosing to work in primary care settings. Ruano emphasizes the importance of making the profession more attractive to new graduates and calls for better training in primary care during pediatric residency programs. She also mentions ongoing issues with the shortage of pediatric medications in pharmacies. Ruano advocates for ensuring every child in Asturias has access to a primary care pediatrician and suggests various measures to improve pediatric care in rural areas.

title: Alarma entre los pediatras por el desabastecimiento de antibióticos claves para el tratamiento de infecciones
summary: Pediatricians in Asturias are raising the alarm over a shortage of key antibiotic syrups used for treating bacterial infections in children, such as Augmentine and Cefuroxime axetil (Cefalosporin), with Amoxicillin also beginning to run low. This situation is described as unprecedented and "third-world" by María Ángeles Ordóñez, president of the Asturian Association of Primary Care Pediatrics (AAPAP). The shortage is significantly impacting pediatric treatment options, as dosages for children often need to be precisely adjusted based on weight, making alternative medications difficult to substitute. The cause of the shortage is unclear, prompting calls for authorities and the pharmaceutical sector to take action to resolve this critical issue and ensure essential medications are available for the pediatric population.

title: La UAL y el Instituto Balmis difundirán y promocionarán conjuntamente el conocimiento de las vacunas - UALNEWS
summary: The University of Almería (UAL) and the Balmis Institute have signed a collaboration agreement to disseminate and promote knowledge of vaccines. This agreement includes organizing activities such as courses, lectures, conferences, and meetings, with the aim of fostering research in vaccinology and related areas, as well as raising awareness about the importance of immunization. Both entities seek to update and disseminate scientific advances in the field of Health Sciences, especially regarding the technological development of vaccines. A joint commission has been established for the programming, monitoring, and evaluation of the activities derived from the agreement, which has a duration of 4 years. This agreement reflects UAL's commitment to social interest, in this case, through the prevention of preventable infectious diseases.

title: La UAL hablará sobre vacunación en uno de sus cursos de verano
summary: The University of Almería (UAL) will offer a summer course titled 'A new era in the prevention of infectious diseases through immunization', from July 3 to 5 at the Castillo de Santa Ana in Roquetas de Mar. The course, led by Professor Gabriel Aguilera and the president of the Balmis Institute of Vaccines, Francisco Giménez, is designed for health and social science professionals, offering 30 places. It will focus on providing specialized training in the planning, research, programming, management, coordination, and evaluation of vaccines. Additionally, it will promote debate and updates on recent advances in vaccination, encourage collaboration on future research projects in this field, and seek to improve public perception of vaccines, using the recent Covid-19 pandemic as a context for debate.

title: El Balmis Knows 2023 analiza el estado de las vacunas para prevenir varios tipos de cáncer | @diariofarma
summary: El Balmis Knows 2023 is a congress on vaccinology organized by the Balmis Institute of Vaccines and the Official College of Physicians of Almería, which will be held in Almería on October 26 and 27. The event will focus on the current state of vaccines to prevent various types of cancer, with a featured presentation on the development and research of cancer vaccines, offered by José Gómez Rial. Francisco Giménez Sánchez, director of the congress, mentioned that currently there is only one vaccine, the HPV vaccine, that protects against cancers caused by the human papillomavirus, but there are advanced research on vaccines for other cancers such as melanoma and lung cancer. In addition, the congress will address what has been learned from the Covid-19 pandemic with a lecture by Maria Van Kerkhove from the WHO, and will feature the participation of international experts such as professors from Yale University and Professor Ron Dagan. Topics such as immunization, vaccination schedules will be discussed, and awards will be given to outstanding contributors in the field.

title: Almería acoge la 'cumbre' sobre inmunización de la Coalition for Life-Course Immunisation | @diariofarma
summary: Almería is set to host the European summit on life-course immunization from November 22 to 24, 2023, organized by the Balmis Institute of Vaccines in collaboration with the Coalition for Life-Course Immunisation (CLCI) and UNED Almería. The summit will gather experts from a dozen European countries, including Germany, Portugal, the United Kingdom, Spain, Italy, France, Lithuania, the Netherlands, Sweden, and Belgium, to discuss the importance of vaccination at all life stages. Topics will cover promoting healthy aging, the role of the European Union in lifelong immunization, lessons from the COVID-19 pandemic, the impact of climate change on future pandemics, refugee and migrant health, and effective communication strategies for vaccination. Francisco Giménez Sánchez, director of the Balmis Institute of Vaccines, will lead a session on pandemic lessons, emphasizing the Italian experience and the need for political will in emergency health situations. The summit aims to enhance life-course immunization strategies by bringing together health professionals and experts across Europe.

title: Profesionales sanitarios de Jaén y Córdoba viajan a Guatemala para participar en proyectos de cooperación
summary: Six health professionals from Jaén and Córdoba will travel to Guatemala from April 5 to April 23 to participate in a medical expedition organized by the Association Seeds of Hope. The team includes two family doctors, a nurse, a radiologist, and two nurses from different hospitals in Jaén and Córdoba. They will work in Primary Care and Radiology in rural communities of extreme poverty in Retalhuleu, as well as carry out training projects and health education programs, with a special focus on women living with HIV. They will also contribute to a child nutrition project in Antigua. The expedition has the support of the Andalusian Health Service, the Official College of Physicians of Jaén, and the Provincial Council of Jaén, which has donated electromedical equipment worth 26,000 euros. This initiative adds to other humanitarian projects involving health professionals from the province.

title: Cita para celebrar y reivindicar por el bien de la profesión médica
summary: Linares hosted the institutional events for the commemoration of Doctor's Day by the Official College of Physicians of Jaén, highlighting the importance of the medical profession in the current health system. The president, Gerardo Pérez Chica, expressed concern about the healthcare system in the province, including the shortage of doctors, increased aggressions towards professionals, and the need for a timeline for the implementation and conclusion of the Ciudad Sanitaria. He called for concrete measures to address human resources challenges, security, and infrastructure improvements. Pérez Chica emphasized the need to retain young and talented doctors by offering better contracts, a more favorable valuation of their experience, and adequate compensation. The event also included the distinction of honorary members, the awarding of the Best MIR Final Record 2023, and the 'Friend of the College of Physicians of Jaén' award to Juan Gómez Ortega. Additionally, a donation from the college's annual budget was given to NGOs focused on socio-health projects.

title: Caja Rural renueva el convenio de colaboración con los médicos de Jaén
summary: Caja Rural de Jaén has renewed its collaboration agreement with the Official College of Physicians of the province, represented by their respective leaders, Juan Núñez Pérez and Gerardo Pérez Chica. This renewal, announced on May 4, 2023, extends the partnership for two years, offering financial services and funding lines tailored to meet the needs of the medical community in Jaén. The agreement includes personal and mortgage loans, productive activity lines for medical consultations, billing advances, and digital banking services. Additionally, it covers the subsidy of the first annual fee for new MIR training doctors and supports the doctors' research and academic work through awards for scientific papers and doctoral theses. The event was also attended by other notable figures from both the financial and medical institutions.

title: Un proyecto de investigación explora los beneficios del ejercicio físico adaptado para la salud cardiovascular
summary: A research project is being conducted to explore the benefits of adapted physical exercise for cardiovascular health in individuals with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE). The initiative, supported by the Municipal Sports Institute of El Ejido, offers participants the opportunity to engage in adapted sports activities in the facilities of the El Ejido Sports Pavilion. These sessions, supervised by professionals with degrees in Sports Science and doctorates in the field, are designed to fit the joint pathology of the disease and its stages. The project, which includes 48 sessions over 24 weeks, aims to objectively measure the impact of physical exercise on clinical-analytical parameters related to SLE, mental health, and vascular risk in patients from the Poniente region. It is promoted by the Andalusian Association of Autoimmune Diseases (AADEA) and the Faculty of Sports Sciences of the University of Almería, involving specialists in Internal Medicine, Nephrology, and Nursing from the Poniente Hospital, as well as the Andalusian Society of Arterial Hypertension and Vascular Risk (SAHTA), with collaboration from various local associations and municipalities.

title: El Colegio Médicos de Burgos y Daiichi Sankyo organizan una campaña de prevención del riesgo cardiovascular ...
summary: The Burgos Medical Association and Daiichi Sankyo are organizing a cardiovascular risk prevention campaign, coinciding with the European Cardiovascular Risk Day on March 14th. The campaign aims to raise awareness about the importance of knowing the risk factors for cardiovascular diseases, the leading cause of death in Spain and Europe. Free diagnostic tests will be offered to detect dyslipidemia or atrial fibrillation at the headquarters of the Official College of Physicians of Burgos. The exams include cholesterol analysis, blood pressure measurement, and electrocardiograms, with immediate results and personalized medical advice. The initiative responds to the need to identify cardiovascular risk factors early and promote a healthy lifestyle to prevent heart attacks or strokes.

title: La salud trans, eje de la jornada formativa celebrada en la Gota de Leche
summary: The training day on trans health was held at La Gota de Leche, organized by Llar Trans in collaboration with the Asturian Society of Family and Community Medicine. This event, held in October, a month considered by Trans groups as "their month," featured the participation of health sector professionals such as the gynecologist Rosa Almirall and the Family and Community Medicine specialist, Joana Cabrera. The training, funded by the Principality, attracted about 70 students, including teaching and law professionals. A roundtable on Trans Health was held in collaboration with the International Society of Bioethics (SIBI), where healthcare models for trans people and the adaptation of health protocols following the approval of Law 4/2023, known as the ‘Trans Law’, were discussed.

title: Alimentación y nutrición | Evidencia científica
summary: The Food and Nutrition Working Group of semFYC focuses on providing information based on the best scientific evidence to improve the quality of dietary-nutritional recommendations in daily consultation. This effort seeks to counteract the prevalent nutritional misinformation in the media, which often lacks rigor and transparency, generating confusion and discrediting the science of nutrition among professionals, patients, and the general population. With the goal of keeping professionals updated and promoting proper nutrition that not only extends the life of patients but also improves their quality, the group has created a new section to spread reviews and positions. The coordination of the group is led by Violeta Ramírez Arroyo, and it includes members from various federated societies. In addition, recent activities such as support for the regulation of ultra-processed foods and the celebration of the Week of the Legume are highlighted, emphasizing the importance of sustainable production and nutrition in specific events and programs.

title: Una profesional del Hospital Santa Cristina, premiada en el Congreso Nacional de Enfermería Nefrológica
summary: Beatriz Liébana, a nurse at Hospital Universitario Santa Cristina in Madrid, was awarded the Fundación Renal Excellence in Communication Award by the Spanish Society of Nephrology Nursing (SEDEN) for her study on pain assessment and management during hemodialysis sessions. This pioneering study in Spain, without international precedents, gathered responses from over 240 nephrological nursing professionals nationwide. It exposed the inconsistency in pain management practices and the absence of specialized protocols and training for pain management in hemodialysis. The results underline the necessity for dedicated protocols and training to enhance the quality of life for hemodialysis patients. Liébana carried out this national observational study alongside Mª Trinidad Quesada and Antonio Ochando from the Complejo Hospitalario de Jaén, discovering that 80% of participants did not have pain management protocols, highlighting the critical need for specific training and the development of protocols in this field.

title: Una enfermera del Materno de Málaga asume la Vocalía de Pediatría de la Sociedad Española de Enfermería ...
summary: Inmaculada Moreno González, a nurse from the Maternal and Child Hospital of Málaga, has been appointed as the pediatric representative of the Spanish Society of Nephrology Nursing (Seden), a position that had been inactive for ten years. This appointment was formalized in Madrid during a representative replacement ceremony of Seden, the oldest and largest nephrology nursing society in Spain. Moreno González, recognized for her significant contributions to pediatric nursing, aims to lead projects focused on improving training, research, and humanization in the field. José Torres, the deputy director of nursing at the hospital, expressed gratitude for Moreno's dedication and acknowledged the honor this appointment represents for both the individual and the hospital, highlighting the recognition of the pediatric dialysis unit's trajectory and work. Seden, founded in 1976, is a non-profit scientific institution with around 1500 members, dedicated to the general interest and public utility, impacting not only its members but also the broader society and individuals affected by kidney diseases.

title: Más de 400 expertos en Nefrología se dan cita en Pamplona para abordar los avances en la enfermedad renal
summary: More than 400 nephrology professionals, specialized nurses, and researchers from all over Spain and international speakers will gather in Pamplona from February 22 to 24 to discuss advancements in kidney disease treatment in Spain. The 'XIII National Meeting on Peritoneal Dialysis and Home Hemodialysis,' organized by the Spanish Society of Nephrology (SEN) and the Spanish Society of Nephrological Nursing (Seden), will focus on sharing progress such as peritoneal dialysis and home hemodialysis, which are renal replacement treatment techniques performed at home. These advancements offer clinical benefits like the possibility of more frequent dialysis schedules compared to hospital hemodialysis, better hemodynamic tolerance, fewer dietary restrictions, and longer maintenance of residual renal function. Chronic kidney disease, affecting 15% of the adult population in Spain, is highlighted as a "silent epidemic" with a high rate of underdiagnosis. The number of people requiring renal replacement therapy has increased by 30% in the last decade, with 66,982 people in Spain on dialysis or having undergone a transplant. The meeting emphasizes the importance of early detection programs in at-risk populations to diagnose the disease before it reaches advanced stages.

title: Una enfermera del Materno de Málaga asume la Vocalía de Pediatría de la Sociedad Española de Enfermería Nefrológica
summary: Inmaculada Moreno González, a nurse from the Materno Infantil Hospital in Málaga, has been appointed as the pediatric representative of the Spanish Society of Nephrology Nursing (SEDEN). This significant appointment was made official in Madrid during a ceremony for the handover of roles within SEDEN, marking a notable achievement for Moreno González, who has an extensive career in pediatric nursing. Her primary goal in this role is to implement improvement projects focusing on training, research, and the humanization of care. The recognition is also seen as an honor for the Materno Infantil Hospital, highlighting the exemplary standards of quality maintained in complex units like pediatric dialysis. The Spanish Society of Nephrology Nursing, founded in 1976, serves as a scientific and non-profit institution, uniting around 1500 nephrology nursing professionals across Spain, aiming to benefit the general public and specifically individuals affected by kidney diseases.

title: Dos trabajos de un equipo de Enfermería de Hemodiálisis del Servet, premios nacionales
summary: A Hemodialysis Nursing team from the Miguel Servet University Hospital (HUMS) in Zaragoza has been awarded two national prizes by the Spanish Society of Nephrology Nursing. The first prize, Seden Donation and Transplant, was awarded to a study on weight gain and changes in body composition after a kidney transplant, led by Emilia Ferrer López, which included 112 patients. This study showed a moderate increase in weight, mainly of muscle over fat, which is beneficial for the health of the transplanted patients. The second prize recognized innovation in dialytic techniques and was for a work on the early detection of stenosis in native arteriovenous fistulas, directed by Francisco Javier Rubio Castañeda. This study highlights the importance of early detection of stenosis to prevent complications in patients undergoing hemodialysis. Both works will be presented at the XLVIII National Congress of the Seden in Salamanca.

title: Profesionales de enfermería del Hospital Gregorio Marañón inician un trabajo sobre conciliación en la nefrología
summary: Nursing professionals at the Gregorio Marañón Hospital have started a study on work-life balance in nephrology. This research, unique in its focus on nephrological nursing, is supported by the Jandry Lorenzo Scholarship from the Spanish Society of Nephrology Nursing (SEDEN), acknowledging the lack of specific data in this field. The project, led by María Ruiz García and her team, aims to investigate the personal, family, and professional balance of nephrological nurses in Spain. It will be presented at the 49th National Congress of the Spanish Society of Nephrology Nursing in 2024 in Valencia. The study examines the challenges faced by nephrological nurses, including shift work necessary for continuous patient care in various settings like dialysis, consultations, hospitalization, and transplantation. The objective is to understand the impact of work-life balance on nurses' future planning, beyond those with family responsibilities.

title: El Hospital Mancha Centro certifica la calidad de su Unidad de Enfermedad Renal Crónica Avanzada
summary: The Mancha Centro Hospital, located in Alcázar de San Juan, Ciudad Real, has renewed its quality certificate for its Advanced Chronic Kidney Disease Unit (ERCA) granted by the Spanish Society of Nephrology (SEN), with the collaboration of ALCER, SEDEN, and the ONT. This certificate, which is pioneering at a global level, is held by only 18% of Spanish hospitals. The unit has reached level III of quality, standing out in the care of patients who are candidates for dialysis and kidney transplant. The accreditation recognizes the work of the nephrology team and is based on 70 standards grouped into five blocks that include general requirements, resources, processes, patient rights and safety, and outcomes. The education and training of patients are key to the management of the disease and the choice of the most appropriate renal replacement treatment.

title: Nueva plataforma Salud Renal Siempre
summary: The Renal Foundation has launched "Renal Health Always", a digital platform endorsed by the Spanish Society of Nephrology, ALCER, and SEDEN, aimed at patients with kidney disease and their families. Its goal is to raise awareness on how to take care of kidney health, offering resources such as videos, podcasts, and infographics made by patients and professionals. The platform covers four thematic blocks: prevention and kidney health, kidney disease, dialysis, and transplant, focusing on the quality and accessibility of information. Additionally, it answers more than 150 questions related to diagnosis, treatment, and emotional management of the disease. The initiative seeks to educate society about the importance of early diagnosis and risk factor management, although it emphasizes that it does not replace consultation with a healthcare professional.

title: Salamanca, sede del congreso nacional de SEDEN
summary: The Spanish Society of Nephrology Nursing (SEDEN) is set to hold its annual congress in Salamanca, focusing on various aspects of renal patient care, prevention, and both the current state and future of renal disease. The event will feature a keynote on patient safety and medication by Alfonso Domínguez-Gil Hurlé, alongside discussions on pain management, therapy types, dialysis unit safety plans, patient humanization, and organ donation updates. The congress will showcase 178 research projects and conclude with a lecture by Hildegart González Luis on nursing's media image. Notable attendees include representatives from the National Transplant Organization, National Federation ALCER Spain, and Spanish Society of Nephrology.

title: Un equipo de enfermería del Servet recibe dos premios nacionales
summary: A nursing team from the Hospital Universitario Miguel Servet has been awarded two national prizes by the Spanish Society of Nephrology Nursing. The awards recognized their work on weight gain after kidney transplantation and a study for the early detection of stenosis in native fistulas. The weight gain study, led by Emilia Ferrer López, involved 112 patients aged between 18 and 80 who received kidney transplants at the hospital. The research, which included four weight measurements post-transplant, won the SEDEN Donation and Transplant Award. Additionally, Francisco Javier Rubio led the team in another awarded study focusing on first-generation methods to detect stenosis signs early in dialysis techniques, which will be presented at the XLVIII National Congress of the SEDEN in Salamanca in October.

title: El Gobierno regional agradece que la Real Academia de Medicina de Castilla-La Mancha apueste por el talento de los ...
summary: The Castilla-La Mancha Government thanked the Royal Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha for acknowledging the talent of the region's public health professionals, especially those in SESCAM. Over half of the Academy's 24 members are from SESCAM. This was noted when Dr. Cristina Romero, the Radiodiagnosis Service head at the University Hospital of Toledo and a global leader in breast cancer diagnosis, was inducted into the Academy. Health Minister Jesús Fernández Sanz highlighted the commitment to health improvement in the region, commending Dr. Romero's 25 years of work in breast cancer detection and her role in the MammoWave research project, aimed at innovating breast cancer diagnosis and treatment. Dr. Romero's work, combining digital mammography and artificial intelligence, is considered crucial in advancing medical practice and research in Castilla-La Mancha.

title: "Ahora mismo no tenemos relevo generacional" | Noticias La Tribuna de Albacete
summary: Dr. Pedro Tárraga, a Family Medicine physician with 35 years of experience in both rural and urban settings in Albacete, received recognition from the Royal Academy of Medicine of Spain for his professional work and contribution to medical education. Tárraga, who is also the medical coordinator at the Zona 5-A health center and the president of the Royal Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha, highlighted the lack of generational replacement in the medical field. He noted that the situation is partially managed by extending the retirement age of current professionals, but young doctors are not staying in the province, leading to a reliance on foreign doctors to fill the gap. This recognition comes at a time when the primary care sector is experiencing significant strain and calls for a model change, coinciding with the 40th anniversary of primary care reform.

title: Pascual Molina destaca que la Real Academia de Medicina "refleja la formación humanística de los
summary: Pascual Molina highlighted the role of the Royal Academy of Medicine in reflecting the humanistic training of doctors and their involvement in society during the Academic Inauguration Ceremony for the 2024 course in Castilla-La Mancha. The event, attended by the president of the medical association, Pedro Juan Tárraga López, included a lecture titled "Family Medicine: From new technologies to great humanity" and the reading of the Academic Report for 2023 by the secretary of the Royal Academy, Juan Solera Albero. Molina praised the institution for combining scientific and artistic culture, emphasizing its contribution to health and biomedical research, which is vital for the well-being of the population.

title: La futuras generaciones de médicos de familia castellano-manchegos se forman en Ruidera gracias a SEMG
summary: The future generations of family doctors from Castilla-La Mancha are being trained in Ruidera thanks to the SEMG. This training event, held on April 19 and 20, was organized by the Castilian-Manchegan Society of General Practitioners and Family Doctors (SEMG Castilla La Mancha) and endorsed by several prestigious institutions including the Royal Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha, the University of Castilla-La Mancha (UCLM), and the Medical Colleges of Albacete, Ciudad Real, Cuenca, and Toledo, among others. A total of 45 family medicine resident doctors from Castilla-La Mancha participated in the weekend event to update their knowledge. This marks the first training activity endorsed by the Royal Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha, highlighting its commitment to Primary Care and young talent. The training covered various topics chosen by the residents themselves, including spirometry, insulin management for diabetics, out-of-hospital emergencies, acute coronary syndrome, urgent geriatric patient care, and a dermatoscopy workshop.

title: La Real Academia de Medicina, a falta de once nombres
summary: The Real Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha is expanding with the addition of five new corresponding members: José Molina Cabildo, Miguel Ángel Cuesta Valentín, Begoña Martínez Jarreta, María Teresa Santamaría Hernández, and Jesús Salas Nieto, serving as advisors. Despite these new additions, the institution still needs eleven full members to fill all 35 seats. The recent appointees have distinguished backgrounds in various medical fields, including forensic medicine, medical translation, medical leadership, laparoscopic surgery, and cardiology. The Academy, which evolved from the Society of Medicine and Surgery of Albacete founded in 1968, aims to promote medical science and research. It advises the regional government and collaborates with other academies, requiring its full members to have a recognized scientific or professional reputation in medicine or related sciences, a doctorate, and a connection to Castilla-La Mancha.

title: La Consejería de Sanidad y la Real Academia de Medicina de Castilla-La Mancha mantienen una reunión para ...
summary: The Health Department and the Royal Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha held a meeting on April 19, 2023, to assess the activities and actions planned through their collaborative efforts. This meeting, part of a series of regular encounters initiated two years ago, aims to advance the study, research, and dissemination of medical knowledge. The Health Minister, Jesús Fernández Sanz, highlighted the government's commitment to this collaboration, involving not only the Health Department but also the Department of Education, Culture, and Sports. The meeting took place at the academy's headquarters in the Posada del Rosario, Albacete, with significant participation from both sides, including academics led by President Pedro Tárraga. The origins of the academy trace back to the Sociedad de Medicina y Cirugía de Albacete, established in 1968, which became the Royal Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha in 2018 and now includes 24 numerary academics.

title: Albacete. La Real Academia de Medicina incorpora a cinco nuevos miembros
summary: The Royal Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha has incorporated five new academic members, as announced by the Ministry of Education, Culture and Sports. The new members, appointed to serve as "advisors or counselors," have one year to officially take up their positions. The appointees include José Molina Cabildo, Miguel Ángel Cuesta Valentín, Begoña Martínez Lejarreta, María Teresa Santamaría Hernández, and Jesús Salas Nieto, with the latter two being from the city of Albacete. The Academy, which currently has 24 members, aims to complete its composition up to 35 members. This movement is part of a process of configuration and growth of the institution, which originated from the Society of Medicine and Surgery of Albacete in 1968 and was officially recognized by Decree 255/2019 of the Government of Castilla-La Mancha. Additionally, the Academy has moved its headquarters to the iconic Posada del Rosario building in Albacete, seeking to establish a closer link with the community and promote research and knowledge in the field of medicine and health sciences.

title: El anestesiólogo que apostó por Ciudad Real
summary: Dr. Francisco Javier Redondo Calvo, a leading anesthesiologist and researcher at the General University Hospital of Ciudad Real, has been admitted to the Royal Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha. His work during the pandemic, both in patient care and research, particularly on COVID-19 and the properties of garlic from his hometown Las Pedroñeras, has been notable. Redondo Calvo, originally from a farming family, chose to pursue his career in Ciudad Real over Madrid, contributing significantly to the region's healthcare system. He has been involved in various research projects, including the study of garlic's potential in treating sepsis, wound healing, and cancer, and leading a clinical trial on aprotinin for severe COVID-19 cases without industry support. He will deliver a lecture on sepsis, termed the new pandemic of the 21st century, at the Royal Academy.

title: "La investigación con ajo y uva podría ayudar en la sepsis"
summary: Research on garlic and grape may help in treating sepsis, says Dr. Francisco Javier Redondo Calvo, newly affiliated with the Royal Academy of Medicine of Castilla-La Mancha. Dr. Redondo Calvo, a leader in medical research and head of Anesthesiology and Resuscitation at the General University Hospital of Ciudad Real, seeks to validate the health benefits of purple garlic, known anecdotally. He warns sepsis could be a major 21st-century pandemic, affecting an estimated 48 million and causing 11 million deaths yearly. His work explores effective sepsis treatments, including the benefits of garlic and grape polyphenols. Dr. Redondo Calvo has patented freeze-dried garlic as a sepsis immunomodulator, potentially enhancing antibiotic therapy.

title: Nueva sede y servicio psicológico de ACEIIO
summary: The Canary Association of Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Ostomy (ACEIIO) has introduced a new psychological service and opened a new headquarters within the Center for Comprehensive Care for People with Disabilities in Los Realejos. This initiative aims to enhance visibility and improve the social and health conditions of patients and their families affected by inflammatory bowel disease and ostomy. The mayor of Los Realejos, Adolfo González, and the councilor for Disability, Macarena Hernández, visited the new facilities and met with ACEIIO's president, Salu Grillo, and vice president, Óliver García Grillo, along with the new coordinator and psychologist, Olga Martín Felipe. They discussed the launch of the psychological service and other new projects designed to support patients and their families, aiming to improve their quality of life and social and health conditions.

title: Urólogos de toda España asisten en Jaén a la XIII Reunión Nacional del Grupo Español de Cáncer Renal y Tumor ...
summary: Urologists from all over Spain have gathered in Jaén for the XIII National Meeting of the Spanish Group for Renal Cancer and Bladder Tumor, organized by specialists from the University Hospital of Jaén and led by the head of the Urology Service, Juan Moreno. This meeting, which brings together a hundred urologists, focuses on updates in the treatment of patients with advanced and metastatic prostate cancer, highlighting the advances made in the last ten years thanks to the emergence of new drugs, which have increased patient survival by more than five years. In addition, the first results of a clinical trial in bladder cancer promoted by the Spanish Association of Urology have been presented. This year, as a novelty, the sessions include updates on the management of patients with urothelial and prostate cancer, highlighting the positive impact of new hormonal drugs and PARP enzyme inhibitors on patient survival.

title: Jornadas para “Humaniz-Arte en el cuidar” en el Hospital de La Princesa
summary: The University Hospital of La Princesa will host the XXVIII Health Humanization Conference on Tuesday, November 21, 2023, organized by the San Camilo Center. This free event aims to promote humanization in healthcare, starting at 9:00 AM with opening speeches followed by lectures and experience-sharing sessions led by professionals in the field. Among the speakers are José Carlos Bermejo, director of the San Camilo Health Humanization Center, and Fidel Delgado, clinical psychologist and writer. The day will also include a workshop on support in complex situations and will conclude with the presentation of the VIII HUMANIZAR Awards, which recognize individuals and entities that contribute to the humanization of health. Registration is free and necessary to attend the event, which also has the support of the Prim Group.

title: Un artículo de Farmacia Hospitalaria analiza 462 mezclas analgésicas en hospitales españ
summary: An article in the Hospital Pharmacy journal analyzes 462 analgesic mixtures in Spanish hospitals, with morphine being the most used analgesic. The MEDPAIN project identified 137 combinations, mostly involving opioids like morphine along with adjunctive medications such as antiemetics, antispasmodics, and sedatives. The authors, specialists in Hospital Pharmacy and members of the Pain and Pharmacotechnics working groups of the Spanish Society of Hospital Pharmacy (SEFH), aim to understand these mixtures and provide necessary information for their safe use in patients. The mixtures are primarily used for acute pain treatment, especially postoperative pain, and to a lesser extent for palliative sedation and chronic pain, particularly oncological pain. The project seeks to document the stability and suitability of these mixtures for continued use, highlighting the pharmacist's role in ensuring patient safety.

title: El Gobierno de Canarias garantiza cobertura sanitaria a los canarios en situación de vulnerabilidad en Venezuela
summary: The Government of the Canary Islands has renewed an agreement with the Spain Health Foundation (FES) in Venezuela, ensuring healthcare coverage and access to medicines for Spanish citizens of Canary origin in vulnerable situations in Venezuela. This agreement, signed after three annual extensions of the initial 2019 agreement, currently benefits 1,167 Canarians, offering comprehensive medical assistance services. The renewal, which follows a brief period of service interruption, will extend for six months, with a budget of 1,100,000 euros for 2023. This effort is part of a broader initiative that began in 2009, seeking to ensure healthcare for vulnerable Canarians in Venezuela, who are not covered by the limited Spanish state medical assistance for those over 65 years of age. The Government of the Canary Islands, in collaboration with the General Directorate of Spanish Citizenship Abroad, seeks to improve and extend this coverage, focusing on the quality and supervision of the agreement.

title: El Gobierno canario firma un convenio para la cobertura sanitaria de 1.185 canarios en Venezuela
summary: The Government of the Canary Islands has signed a new agreement with the Fundación España Salud to ensure health coverage for 1,185 Canary Islanders or their descendants living in Venezuela, who are in vulnerable situations and not protected by the state. This agreement comes after the previous contract, which had been extended annually since 2019, was not renewed, leaving over 1,200 Canary Islanders without health coverage as of January 1st this year. The new six-month agreement reinstates all medical assistance and access to medicines previously provided. This initiative is part of the Autonomous Community's efforts since 2009 to support its vulnerable citizens in Venezuela, with a budget of 1.1 million euros allocated for this purpose in 2023, maintained for 2024. The vice-counselor of External Action highlighted the agreement's importance for updating services and costs, ensuring quality control, and continuing to provide essential health services to those in need.

title: Miranda y el director de la Fundación España Salud planifican la colaboración a desarrollar durante el nuevo año ...
summary: Antonio Rodríguez Miranda, the Secretary of Emigration, met with Álvaro Gómez, director of the Fundación España Salud, to outline their collaboration for the new year in Venezuela. They aim to continue supporting the socio-health needs of Galicians living in Venezuela, building on a €100,000 agreement with the foundation. This partnership focuses on providing medical and pharmaceutical care to Galicians with limited financial resources, often of advanced age, benefiting over 1,300 individuals.

title: Torres conoce la Fundación España Salud en Caracas que asiste a 3.400 canarios y dice que su servicio es ...
summary: The President of the Canary Islands, Ángel Víctor Torres, visited the Spain Health Foundation (FES) in Caracas, which assists 6,500 Spaniards, of whom 3,400 are Canarians. He highlighted the FES's service as "fundamental" and emphasized the work of its staff and inter-administrative collaboration. The FES provides primary care, hospitalization, surgery, home emergency care, and medication for chronic patients. The contribution of the Canary Islands Government to the FES has increased to 1.1 million euros in 2023. Torres stressed the importance of the healthcare provided by the FES given the difficulties in accessing medications in Venezuela and mentioned efforts to extend health coverage to other groups of the emigrant population.

title: Jornada 'El papel de la autorregulación en la promoción de medicamentos'
summary: The Real Academia de Medicina de Cataluña and Farmaindustria are organizing an event titled 'The Role of Self-Regulation in the Promotion of Medications' on November 16, 2023, in Barcelona. The session, taking place from 16:30 to 19:00 at the Academy's headquarters, aims to examine the self-regulation system within the pharmaceutical industry. This system, a pioneering model in Spain initiated over 20 years ago, was developed as a voluntary response by pharmaceutical companies to meet the expectations of their stakeholders and society at large. It sets forth criteria and standards of conduct to ensure trust and credibility in the promotion of medications and the interactions of the pharmaceutical industry. Attendance requires prior registration due to limited capacity.

title: Médicos aconsejan el cribado universal de embarazadas para evitar transmisión VIH a hijos
summary: Doctors and the Ministry of Health in Spain recommend universal HIV screening for all pregnant women in the first and third trimesters, regardless of risk, to eliminate transmission of the virus from mothers to children. Despite a low vertical transmission rate of 0.72%, the goal is its total eradication, emphasizing the importance of women with HIV reaching childbirth with an undetectable viral load. This approach is reflected in an updated consensus document, which also suggests screening for the partners of pregnant women. Early detection and access to antiretroviral treatment are crucial to prevent transmission. Natural conception and childbirth are prioritized in women with an undetectable viral load, and the possibility of natural breastfeeding is opened in special cases.
